snippet: The consular officials were accused of visiting Venezuelan universities to recruit students to organize antigovernment protests.
abstract: Venezuela orders three American Embassy officials to leave country, saying they have been recruiting students to take part in violent antigovernment protests; expulsions are latest in a series that have marked low point in relations between two countries.

byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and ANDREW W. LEHREN
byline.contributor: William Neuman reported from Caracas, and Andrew W. Lehren from Manchester, Vt.

lead_paragraph: The consular officials were accused of visiting Venezuelan universities to recruit students to organize antigovernment protests.

headline.main: Venezuela Cites Unrest in Expelling 3 U.S. Officials
headline.print_headline: Venezuela Cites Unrest in Expelling 3 U.S. Officials
